t: Amazon Private Label Brands - Marketplace Pulse
s: March 18, 2019 - According to Marketplace Pulse research, Amazon-owned private label brands are not nearly as successful as many paint them to be. Amazon has been successful in creating generic items at low prices, but only when using the Amazon brand name (i.e., AmazonBasics and Amazon Essentials).

t: Amazon Puts Its Own “Brands” First Above Better-Rated Products – The Markup
s: In a national survey we commissioned from YouGov, only 17 percent of respondents said they assumed Amazon put its own products first. Half said they expected the first nonsponsored product on Amazon’s search results page to be the cheapest, highest rated, or bestselling. By giving its brands top billing, Amazon is giving itself a significant leg up in sales...

t: Manufacturing View vs. Sourcing View
s: Amazon Vendor Central provides ... for sales and inventory reports. Sourcing View: Sourcing view provides data on ASINs that were actually purchased from the vendor by Amazon. Data from this view is determined based on an ASIN’s vendor code, which is the same code that purchase orders are placed against. Manufacturing View: Manufacturing view provides data on all ASIN’s “owned” by a manufacturer’s brand...
